Cambridge.List Visual Arts Center:
Established in 1985, the List Visual Arts Center (LVAC) is the contemporary art gallery of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (it was preceded by the MIT Hayden Gallery, in a different building). It is known for temporary exhibitions in its galleries located in the MIT Media Lab building, as well as its administration of the permanent art collection distributed throughout the university campus and student housing.


== Description ==
The LVAC is internationally recognized for the 4 to 6 temporary exhibitions it presents each year in its 6,000-square-foot (560 m2) galleries, which are open to the general public.
